subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] EVP and James Randi -- My Questions
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Probably because he wants to stay in his own little world and just say 
that it could've been faked, while ignoring the circumstances anyone 
presents.  He won't take anyone's word that circumstances indicate an EVP 
couldn't have been faked.

Maybe someone should have HIM set up the experiment in a haunted place and 
see if any EVP are gotten. I don't think that has been done (maybe it has 
but I don't know of any).

Zack

On Fri, 27 Jun 2008, earthangel5998 wrote:

> Hi everyone,
>
> I'm sure lots of you know who James Randi is, the skeptic who offers $1
> million for proof of the paranormal.
>
> I am wondering why there hasn't been an EVP demonstration good enough
> to win the prize. I have never captured an EVP, but many people have
> including those in this group. I cannot say (like James Randi
> apparently and others like him) that I think every person who captured
> an EVP is a fraud or captured a fluke or something like that. I don't
> think that at all, it appears to me that many of them are the real
> deal, of that I am almost 100% certain and will be 100% certain if I
> can ever capture my own.
>
> I don't know a lot about James Randi or EVP for that matter, but it is
> a question that came up. Can anyone enlighten me?
>
> I tried a few sessions last night but came up empty handed. I am
> starting to think my white noise isn't loud enough. I'm going to keep
> trying.
>
> Also I hope to experiment with ITC images. And soon I want to build
> a "box" which I keep hearing so much about. I don't know the first
> thing about these ghost/spirit boxes as I've heard them called, all I
> know is I want to learn to build one and use it as I've heard some
> interesting audio files here. But that's probably a good subject for a
> separate post unless anyone can give me an informative how-to link or
> anything.
>
> Thanks!
> Angela
>
